resources.string: Do you have any questions, feedback, improvements, bug reports or you are just looking for friends? :) Please get in touch with me:

Bitcoin Node Observer has no adds and will be available for free at any time.

Google doesn't allow it to publish a Bitcoin donation address because of their payment policy. :(

But this software is open source, feel free to join the project on Github or contact me and help me improving this app in any other way. More information on Github:
This app uses images and services which are available for free, but should be mentioned somewhere. Here we do. Thanks for your great work.

Bitcoin Node Observer let you observe any public reachable node.

It uses Bitnodes API to gather all the information. So at the moment there is no direct interaction with a Bitcoin node, but this will be considered in a future release.

It works for IP and host addresses. Even Tor (.onion) hosts are possible to observe (at least some information).

If your node is not found, please check that your network is allowing incoming connections. More information here: https://bitcoin.org/en/full-node#network-configuration

In preferences you can activate background synchronisation. Android OS (or the modified version of your phones manufacturer) often prevent apps from doing background operations to save battery. Therefore it is strongly recommended to whitelist this app to get background synchronisation work properly. In the apps log view you can check if the synchronisation is working according your settings. Note, a small time divergence is wanted. It gives Android the opportunity to optimize or assembly work and this is healthy for your battery.
